Description: One half of a limestone stela (the other half is EA 1983), with incised inscriptions on both sides. One side (here called A) bears the lower ten lines of a long text in Coptic (EA 1983 bears the eight preceding lines). The other side (here called B) bears a shorter Greek text of four lines above a cross flanked by two smaller crosses. The two texts are evidently of a different date; one is upside down in relation to the other. One of the narrow sides bears remains of decorative reliefwork, which shows that the slab was extracted from a larger architectural element. If either inscription (side A or B) is viewed the right way up, the narrow decorated side is to its right.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Acquisition date: 1926? (The registration number is problematic. It does not appear in the registration book for 1924, and the stela was excavated in 1926. It is unclear when the registration number was assigned, but the year date was apparently conjectured and attributed years later.)
